clues.text: This sign of the zodiac shares its name with 13 popes
Add an "N" to the end of this sign & you get a type of animal
This sign anagrams to what pepper & cinnamon are
If your mother was in labor on Labor Day, this is your sign
The name of this sign begins with the 19th letter of the Greek alphabet
...of "The Star-Spangled Banner"
...of the nursery rhyme about Jack Sprat
...of the hymn "Amazing Grace"
...of "A Tale of Two Cities"
...of the Preamble to the U.S. Constitution
Mir was a third generation Russian one of these spacecraft & it lasted for 15 years
This term for vehicles like those used in the Mercury program sounds like a small dose of medicine
The first stage of a rocket
This 2-word term for possibly alien spacecraft was 1st used after a pilot reported seeing 9 of them near Mt. Rainier in 1947
Like the Cassini around Saturn, this type of spacecraft by definition doesn't land, but circles a planet instead
Mary, who was "highly favoured" according to Gabriel
Fellow athlete Steffi Graf
Playboy Playmate Crystal Harris
Mavis Nicholson, who got used to late nights
The former Edith Bolling, a First Lady
It's the 2-letter abbreviation for a flow of electric charge that doesn't change direction
Rheostats & potentiometers are types of these devices that oppose the flow of current in electrical circuits
The 2012 merger of Duke & Progress created the USA's largest of these "useful" entities providing electric power
This electromagnetic force that drives a current around a circuit is abbreviated emf
The law named for this 18th century French physicist is the electrical analogue to the law of gravity

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will be two words.  One with a zed or a "Z", the other one without.)

clues.text: A clown loses his "Z" & becomes a shout of disapproval
Lose the "Z" from an Eastern European ruling title & you get a mode of transport
Take the "Z" from several ciphers & you get a Greek god
Oy, I could just take the "Z" off the end of a word from Yiddish meaning "to burst" & get the story of a book or movie
Take the "Z" out of a word meaning "to stun" or "to take aback" & you get a magical word used in fantasy books
Its 2nd verse begins, "My native country, thee, land of the noble free"
In the song "Dixie", "In Dixie Land I'll take my stand to" do these 2 things
"The Yanks are coming, the Yanks are coming" in this George M. Cohan song
Even today, Southerners despise this song because it glorifies Sherman's march to the sea
In the chorus of "The Battle Hymn of the Republic", this single word of praise is sung 6 times
The Bismarck flying fox, this type of mammal, has a 5 1/2 foot wingspan
Of king, queen or soldier, type of termite that has been known to live 50 years
Every year Arctic terns fly over 11,000 miles south to winter on this continent
Blue, lilac & seal are 3 of the official color points of this cat breed
The male of this Arctic aquatic mammal has a single spiral tusk
Anne of Brittany married 2 kings of this country, Charles VIII & Louis XII
Reportedly, the ghosts of Elizabeth I & this woman, her mother, both haunt Windsor Castle
Familial relationship of England's Queen Anne to the queen who preceded her, Mary II
She's the royal mother of Peter & Zara Phillips
This wife of Henry VIII was the daughter of a German duke
In "Desire Under the Elms", Sophia Loren married Burl Ives but lusted after this "Psycho' star
In this comedy based on a 1933 German film, Julie Andrews played a woman playing a man playing a woman
In "Love & Death", Woody Allen plotted to assassinate this emperor
This actress' daughter Tisha Sterling played her as a young woman in "The Whales of August"
Marlene Dietrich's 1st American film, named for the north African country where it was set
Number of dollars in a "C-note"
Referring to the keyboard, this number is a slang term for a piano
At a baseball game, "Take Me Out to the Ballgame" is traditionally played during this inning
In classical mythology, the number of Furies
Number of syllables in a traditional haiku poem
Approximately 18 billion years ago
For the Earth, Vega, Thuban & Polaris all have been, & will in turn become again this star
One of its moons, Titan, is larger than Mercury & has an atmosphere
The word for this celestial body comes from the Greek word for "wanderer"
High energy electromagnetic radiation; who knows their effect on man-in-the-moon marigolds?

rounds.text: These 7 words precede, "The rain fell in torrents, except at occasional intervals"
rounds.response: "It was a dark and stormy night"
